metadata.title: jinzhe.io — Projects & Philosophy
metadata.description: Personal project landing pages + long-form philosophical discussions.

footer.description: Turn long-term questions into systems, and systems into sustainable narratives.

hero.title1: Transform personal projects into landing pages,
hero.title2: turn philosophical discussions into continuous conversations.
hero.description: A continuously evolving personal base: building products and systems while tracking questions that require time to settle. I hope more people can understand my projects and philosophy here, and join this long-term conversation chain.

about.title: About
about.content: I navigate between products, systems, and long-term questions, treating each project as a methodological experiment.

currentFocus.title: Current Focus
currentFocus.description: Centered on multi-agent collaboration systems, continuously exploring the collaboration boundaries of 'humans + systems'.

projectsSection.label: Project Index
projectsSection.title: Each project has its own narrative entry point

ludicSection.label: Ludic Systems
ludicSection.title: Treat human motivation as a first-class system resource
ludicSection.description: An AI-assisted system paradigm: organizing production and creation through 'voluntary goals + self-constraints + meaningful feedback'.
ludicSection.principle1: Productivity is organized as voluntary challenges, not mere efficiency.
ludicSection.principle2: Systems must be citable and independently understandable.
ludicSection.principle3: Long-term questions require structured rhythm and verifiable prototypes.

projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: Each project has its own narrative entry point
projects.description: Each project is an independent narrative entry point, recording phased achievements and long-term questions.

commanddeck.title: CommandDeck
commanddeck.description: A visual control console for multi-agent collaboration systems, emphasizing a 'front-store back-factory' collaboration model.

hub.title: HQ (Hub)
hub.description: Centrally receives agent reports, stores historical archives, and provides analysis capabilities.

desktop.title: Front Store (Desktop UI)
desktop.description: The visual interface for users to observe, schedule, and issue commands.

main.title: Back Factory (Main & Agents)
main.description: Launches agent processes, executes Git operations and code running.

protocol.title: Common Language (Protocol)
protocol.description: Unified protocol based on TypeScript/Zod to ensure communication accuracy.

monitoring.title: Real-time Monitoring
monitoring.description: View runtime status and resource usage of all agents.

timeline.title: Event Timeline
timeline.description: Track every tool call and state change.

conversation.title: Interactive Conversation
conversation.description: Have conversations and assign tasks with specific agents.

multiproject.title: Multi-project Support
multiproject.description: Manage multiple projects and agents in parallel.

ludic.title: Ludic Systems
ludic.subtitle: Treat human motivation as a first-class system resource
ludic.description: An AI-assisted system paradigm: organizing production and creation through 'voluntary goals + self-constraints + meaningful feedback'.
ludic.positioning: This is not a personal blog, but a system object that can be cited and replicated.

jinzheio.title: jinzhe.io — Personal Root Node
points: Define who you are and what objects you've proposed.
Serve as the index entry for concepts and systems.

ludicSystems.title: ludic.systems — System Root Node
points: Focus only on Ludic Systems itself.
Present mechanisms, protocols, and interaction methods.
You are the proposer, not the protagonist.

whitepaper.title: Whitepaper
whitepaper.description: Definition and motivation, explaining why it exists.

engine.title: Ludic Engine
engine.description: Components, dynamics, state machines, and failure modes.

community.title: Community
community.description: Who's using, replicating, and extending it.

principles.title: Core Principles
items: Productivity is organized as voluntary challenges, not mere efficiency.
Systems must be citable and independently understandable.
Long-term questions require structured rhythm and verifiable prototypes.

philosophy.title: Long-term philosophical discussions are not one-time conclusions,
philosophy.titleContinued: but a continuously updated conversation chain.
philosophy.description: Here I record core questions from long-term research, and how each project iteration validates these questions in return.
philosophy.subtitle: Structured maintenance of long-term questions
philosophy.summary: Break questions into trackable themes, making thinking a reusable method.

agency.title: Agency / 主体性
agency.summary: How to maintain autonomy in complex systems and avoid being domesticated by tools.
questions: In multi-agent collaboration, which layer should responsibility fall on?
How does human judgment negotiate boundaries with automation systems?
When processes become smooth, does intention get diluted?

time.title: Time / 长期主义
time.summary: Build project rhythms and cognitive iterations that span years.
questions: How is the 'growth' of long-term projects measured?
What kind of rhythm doesn't consume creativity?
How to make compound interest come from structure, not luck?

sensemaking.title: Sensemaking / 认知地图
sensemaking.summary: Transform chaotic experience into actionable maps and language.
questions: Under information overload, what are useful abstractions?
How to avoid being controlled by narratives?
How can personal methodology be shared without losing its soul?

practices.title: Monthly Review
practices.description: Categorize new knowledge into 'immediate gains / long-term gains / remaining questions'.

practices.title: Projects as Questions
practices.description: Each project is a methodological experimentation ground.

practices.title: Dialogical Thinking
practices.description: Break long-term questions into continuous conversations, not one-time conclusions.

signals: Long-term questions need visualized rhythms and milestones.
The most important questions often require new language.
Thinking itself also needs design and ritual.
